term.name: monotheism
term.source: From Greek monos: single, and from Greek theos: god.
term.def: The belief that there is only one god, or that the gods of different religions are in fact different manifestations of the one true god. Monotheism is opposed to other forms of &theism; such as &henotheism; and &polytheism;, as well as to &pantheism; and &atheism;.
